titleproper.value: Guide to the Sam Reiss Papers  <num>WAG.262</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-07-20T16:58:25</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: The collection encompasses a small amount of biographical and documentary material on Sam Reiss (1910-1975), one of the most prominent and prolific photographers of the labor movement in New York City from the 1940s through the 1970s. It also includes individual issues from a wide range of labor and liberal political publications in which his photographs were published.

p.value: Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date; Sam Reiss Papers; WAG 262; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Helen and Jessie Reiss in several installments between 1980 and 2008. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 1980.008 and NPA.2009.015.

<list><item>Bildersee, Barnett. "The Camera Eye: Snapping the man in the street." <emph render="italic">New York STAR Picture News</emph>, Sunday, September 12, 1948, p. 14.</item><item>Gene Thornton, "Photography View," <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph>, Sunday, January 25, 1976.</item><item>"Going Out Guide--Labor Log." <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph>, Tuesday, December 16, 1975.</item><item>Klein, H. L. "Focus on 27 years of labor history: LI'ers photos on display." <emph render="italic">Long Island Press</emph>, Sunday, December 7, 1975.</item><item>"Labor Press Photographer Sam Reiss Dies." <emph render="italic">AFL-CIO News</emph>, January 3, 1976.</item><item>Pollack, Michael. "Sam Reiss Dead at 65; Labor Press Photographer." <emph render="italic">Textile Labor</emph>, March 1976, p. 11.</item><item>"Reiss Photos Donated." <emph render="italic">New York Labor Heritage</emph>, Volume 1, No. 4, Summer 1980.</item><item>Rich, Rona. "Sam Reiss Knew His Labor." <emph render="italic">The Village Voice</emph>, December 15, 1975, p. 130.</item><item>"Sam Reiss: Labor Photographer." Labor Press Council of Metropolitan New York. Press release, undated.</item></list>

Bound publications and pamphlets (as well as various published items such as advertisement brochures, organizational creeds, anniversaries and other commemorations) include publications by the following organizations: A. Philip Randolph Institute; Allied Educational Foundation, IBT Local 815; Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America -- including Amalgamated Laundry Workers Joint Board, Louis Simon Scholarship Fund, New York Clothing Manufacturers' Exchange, Inc., New York Joint Board, Sidney Hillman Health Center, Philadelphia Joint Board; Amalgamated Lithographers of America Local 1; American Federation of Musicians Local 802, Musicians' Emergency Relief Fund; Brooklyn Children's Museum; Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO); Gandhi Society for Human Rights, Inc.; Haym Salomon Home for the Aged; International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local 3; International Economic Research Bureau; International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union including -- Dressmakers' Joint Council: Amalgamated Cutters' Local 10, Dressmakers' Local 22, Eastern Region, Italian Dressmakers' Local 89, Local 60-60A, Northeast Department; International Rescue Committee; Joint Apprenticeship Program of the Workers Defense League - A. Philip Randolph Educational Fund; New York Cardiac Center, Inc.; New York State Commission Against Discrimination; Retail, Wholesale and Department Store Union, including -- Retail Drug Employees Union Local 1199 <emph render="italic">1199 Drug News</emph>; Retail, Wholesale, Chain Store Food Employees Union, Local 338; Sidney Hillman Foundation; State of New York Workmen's Compensation Board; Sullivan County Hotel Association; Transport Workers Union of America, AFL-CIO; United Housing Foundation, including: Amalgamated-Warbasse Houses; Seward Park Housing Corporation; Veterans Administration (Veterans Hospital); Radio and Television Guild; Welfare and Health Council of New York City; Women's League for Israel.
